result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Maynard W. Hilleshiem was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challange Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Stubstance Abuse Program AFTER 18 months Initial Confinement.
Apply 54 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine - PAID IN FULL.

Attend Victim Impact Panel.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cash bail applied to Court Costs and DNA Surcharge - PAID IN FULL.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant Maynard W. Hilleshiem in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Mathew D. from the Village of Pewaukee was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the State. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves to for bind over. Defense object with no arguments. State finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Arraignment scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Atty. Jorge Fragoso appointed for the defendant.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
